column1: San Antonio Oeste is a port city in the Argentine province of Río Negro
column2: and head of the department of San Antonio.

column1: The town is bordered by its sister communities of San Antonio Este
column4: to the southwest. Discovered by an expedition of the Spanish Empire in 1779
column5: San Matías Gulf became the site of an outpost
column6: San Antonio (so named in honor of St. Anthony of Padua). Water scarcity led the original settlement to fail in 1905
column7: leading the community to settle west of the gulf
column8: in what today is San Antonio Oeste.

column1: The arrival of the Buenos Aires Great Southern Railway in its expansion towards Bariloche in 1910 led to the hamlet's growth. It later became the site of Punta Verde
column2: the leading port for the large wool export industry of Patagonia
column3: though the collapse in the wool market during the 1930s and 1940s led to the port's closure in 1944.

column1: San Antonio Oeste benefited afterwards from a growth in tourism in nearby Las Grutas
column2: a scenic cove known for its grottoes. Since 2000
column3: it has also been home to a growing fishing industry
column4: resulting from the opening of a deep-water port in San Antonio Este.

column1: San Antonio Oeste has a semi-arid climate (Köppen climate classification BSk) with cool winters and hot summers. Winters are characterized with cool temperatures during the day and very cold nights. In the coldest month
column3: the mean temperature is 8.3 °C (46.9 °F). Temperatures can regularly fall below freezing during the winter months although snowfalls rarely occur
column4: averaging 0.2 days with snow per year. During this time of the year
column5: the weather is characterized by cloudy weather in which an average of 9–11 overcast days are recorded per month.Spring and fall are transition seasons featuring mild daytime temperatures and cool nighttime temperatures. Spring starts out cool
column6: with frosts that occur regularly in September with the last date of frost occurring on October 2. However
column7: frosts can occur as late as November 4 It is also a windy season
column8: which can make the temperature feel cooler than it should be. Autumn starts out warm but increasingly becomes cooler in April and May with the frosts that can occur as early as March 26. Normally
column9: the first date of frost occurs on April 28.Summers are hot during the day while nighttime temperatures are mild. It tends to be sunnier than the other seasons with only 4–6 overcast days per month and having 7–11 clear days per month. In the hottest month
column11: the average high is 30.2 °C (86.4 °F) while the average low is 16.6 °C (61.9 °F). During the most extreme heat waves
column12: the temperature can reach above 40 °C (104.0 °F) from November to March. The average relative humidity is 57%
column13: with the winter months being more humid than the winter months. San Antonio Oeste is windy throughout the year with mean wind speeds ranging from a low of 13.8 km/h (8.6 mph) in April to a high of 23.1 km/h (14.4 mph) in December. Precipitation is low throughout the year with San Antonio Oeste receiving 248.0 millimetres (10 in) of precipitation per year with 63 days with measureable precipitation that is fairly evenly distributed throughout the year. There are approximately 2
column14: 633.5 hours of bright sunshine per year or 58.3% of possible sunshine per year
column15: ranging from a low of 45.7% in June (only 136.4 hours of sunshine per month) to a high of 72.0% in February. The highest recorded temperature was 44.6 °C (112.3 °F) while the lowest recorded temperature was −11.5 °C (11.3 °F) on June 22
column16: 2002.Situated in the east coast of northern Patagonia
column17: the annual daily mean in San Antonio Oeste is of 15.3 °C (59.5 °F)
column18: this is significantly higher than the 11.7 °C (53.1 °F) average temperature of Valdivia
